data.text:
1Epithelial cells that appear cube like when an organ is relaxed and flattened when the organ is distended by fluid are classified as stratified squamous epithelium simple columnar epithelium pseudostratified epithelium simple squamous epithelium transitional epithelium 2Basement membranes attach epithelial cells to the underlying tissue are secreted partially by epithelial cells and partially by the cells of the underlying Otissue None of these is correct function as a filter and barrier to cell or pathogen movement function as a filter and barner to cell or pathogen movement attach epithelial cells to the underlying tissue and are secreted partially by epithelial cells and partially by the cells of the underlying tissue are true of basement membranes

7 Epithelial cells that appear cube like when an organ is relaxed and flatteried when the organ is distended by fluid are classified as a simple columnar epithelium b pseudostratifled epithelium d Transitional epithelium c stratified squamous epithelium e simple squamous epithelium ANSWER RATIO 8 Epithelium that consists of a single layer of cells in which some cells are tall and thin and reach the free surface and others do not is classified as a simple columnar epithelium d Transitional epithelium b pseudostratified columnar epithelium c stratified squamous epithelium e simple squamous epithelium ANSWER RATIO 9 Which of the following statements is true (Select all that apply) a Transitional epithelium has cells that change shape when the tissue is stretched b Transitional epithelium is found in the lining of the urinary bladder the ureters and the superior urethra c Transitional epithelium is pseudostratified d As transitional epithelium is stretched the number of cell layers increases e Transitional epithellum is found in cavities that can expand greatly in volume ANSWER RATIO 10 Which of the following characteristics of tissues and cells would aid in diffusion or the movement of materials into and out of the body through the epithelium a multiple layers of relatively flat thin cells d a single layer of cuboidal cells b a single layer of relatively flat thin cells e multiple layers of columnar cell c multiple layers of cuboidal cells ANSWER RATIO
